I hate documentation in general...most of it sucks,
and the stuff that doesn't suck is usually either
useless or out of date.  I'd rather have the unit
tests than javadocs any day. ;)

-Eric

--- "Stevens, Timothy J. (LNG-MBC)"
<timothy.j.stevens@...> wrote:
> 
> 	Why do you hate Javadocs, out of curiosity? I think
> they're a great
> tool for easy documentation. 
> 
> 	-tim
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Eric Heikkila [mailto:ericheikkila@...]
> Sent: Monday, February 18, 2002 10:37 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Re: JavaDocs
> 
> 
> JAVADOCS!!!????
> 
> AHHH!!...RUN AWAY!!!!!
> 
> --- "STRAYER, JON (AIT)" <jon.strayer@...>
> wrote:
> > The javadoc task doesn't support the nested
> > "fileset" element.  At least not
> > the one that I have.
> > 
> 
> NESTING!!?? IN JAVADOCS??  RUN AWAY FARTHER!! ;)
> 
> hehe..needless to say, I really can't stand java
> docs.
>  What is it you're trying to document?  Do you
> REALLY
> need to use these, or is there a better way?
> 
> BTW - Just posing the question...don't have any
> answers right now.  Really just wanted to see what
> other people thought about it.
> 
> -Eric
